result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Antonio Smart #367395 Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is granted credit for time served in the amount of 154 days as calculated by the Ashland County Sheriff's Department

6/22/18 JOC is amended to have 154 days sentence credit.
Consecutive to: Consecutive with 18CF43 and 18CF71, as well as any other sentence that the defendant is currently serving.

superMiscConds.notes:
The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!

Def is to undergo counseling for criminal thinking through a Cognitive-Thinking for Change therapy program.
Def is to complete other counseling and other conditions as directed by DOC.

Def is to undero a psych evaluation and follow through with treatment recommendations.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any  mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Defendant is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold  there.

Def is to submit to random U.A.'s.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail.
Defendant is to have NO CONTACT with Jose Suarez, Nickolas Erickson or Douglas Kaseno.
Contraband which has been seized is ordered forfeited.

supervisions.notes:
If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

2 1/2 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision.

(11:00am)  Defendant Jose Antonio Smart #367395 not in court, defendant in custody.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Ct conference calls def and victim, State: re 3/19/18 plea hrg, request clarification of restitution to be ordered or amt of restitution.  Def states didn't know about theft issue at the time of plea bargain, contests owing money, didn't realize terms signed, denies theft.  DA: other read-ins, both of docs reduced, State's position is def needs to take independant action if desired, State request to proceed, Ct grants.  Victim called, sworn, quest by State, no quest by def.  Def gives addl comments, position.  Ct: read-ins made, given testimony, Ct orderes $162.99 as restitution in this case, Ct grants State's request to amend JOC to reflect today's order.

Attorney Travis S Slattery in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ADA comments-- restitution being claimed is the result of a uncharged read-in. Agreement in the case. Def would need to appear. ADA is not prepared to present evidence besides the Document to support the vic's claim for restitution. Def is in Prison at this time. Rest for $283.00.. Atty comments- brief convo about the rest.Atty is looking for support that the def owes the $283.00. State is asking for an adjment that the def can be set up to appear by phone or video. Ct wil adj hearing.. Def is currently at Dodge. Ct grants the State's req. Atty will not be making an appearance for him. Asking for the def to be set up by video conference.  JA will set up the hearing with DODGE on when they have time to hear the hearing.
Def is not set up to appear. Called Dodge and left a Voice mail.

Defendant Jose Antonio Smart in court with attorney Travis S Slattery.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 16CF10,18CF43 and 18CF71- PSI has been filed. DA comments-- not sure a correction, but no record of conviction in 2002 for DC that is in the PSI. Can not verify conviction. Atty comments- no add'l corrections at this time.  DA comments--Agreement is that the State would be bound by the PSI. In other times has not completed probation. Prior criminal history. Asking for Prison sentence. 3rd Fel conviction. State asking for prison- and conditions ABSOL, AODA and follow, NO contact with Jose Suarez, Douglas Kaseno, Nicholas Erickson, COG, and other COunseling, fine and costs, DNA, Psy Eval. Atty comments- hands Ct a Letter from Bad River, For treatment that is available . Ct reviewed the letter. Lived with Grandmother, has 4 children,and strong work ethic, Has AODA issues. Asking for 3 yrs Init and 3 yrs ES- imposed and stayed on fel counts and 10 months jail and 1 yr probation on mism count. Asking for huber, 125 days credit on 16CF10 and 82 days on the other cases. Def comments sentencing, Knows what he did was wrong, was not trying to profit from the Meth in the jail. Just lost everything he had. Not a violent person, made mistakes. Would like Ct to consider his offer. Ct comments on sentencing, Ct Comments does have a prison case. 

18CF43--60 days to jail

Fel Bail jumping - 18CF71-- 120 days jail - 

16CF10-  5 1/2 yrs. 2 1/2 yrs INIT and 3 yrs ES- All Run Consecutive.  207 days and 0 days in other cases. 
Conditions of ES
ABSOL, UA, No contact Jose Suarez, Nickolas Erickson, Douglas Kaseno, Psy eva,  ---( more conditions listed....) 
16CF10 DOC will collect financials. 
Consecutive to any other sentence. 
Any contraband Sezied is ordered forf. 
No gun, no vote. 
DNA in Each Case-  $ 567.63 each Ct.
Prison Elig for both Challenge and substance abuse. 

DA comments- theft that was uncharged and read-in. No rest req in that case- if the Vic does make a req asking to beable to forward req in 30 days. 
Atty comments- asking for Cash bond be returned to Arlene Cash bond. She is on a fixed income, Asking it be returned. 
CT orders-- Ct vactes Judgements- Bail money gets refunded to Arlene and now reimposes the Judgements- same as prev imposed.
Def. motion and notice of motion to amend bond.  Requests a hearing date and mod. req. is so that $500 posted by Arleen Smart may be returned to her.

Defendant Jose Antonio Smart in court with attorney Travis S Slattery.  Kelly McKnight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 3 cases 18CF71,18CF43 and 16CF10. DA believes agreement plea to 16CF10 ct 2, 18cF43 ct 2 and 18CF71 waive prelim plea to Ct 1 any other remaining charges DRI, state will be filing uncharged readin A1-17-400 and FTA in June 12 Parties request PSI and free to argue. Atty Slattery agreement with small caveat correction in offer to settle will plea to resisting and bj will be read in also state will be bound to recommendation. State agrees. 
18CF71 right to prelim, WOPH, Ct finds know/vol waived right to prelim, ct finds prob cause-bound over. 
DA will electronically file Information, paper copy provided to def, Information identical to charges in criminal complaint. Atty Slattery rec information, waives reading, Ct 1 DRI prepared to enter NC plea in Ct 2. DA comments efiled info in 18CF43 meant to file in in 18CF71. 16CF10 Ct 2, 18CF43 obstructing, 18CF71 fbj  charges/penalties read. Def understands pleads NC to each count. 16CF10 admits repeater, 18CF43 admits repeater, 18CF71 admits repeater. 18CF71 admits as a result of felony conviction. 
18CF43 Count1 18CF71 Count 2 DRI.
Ct reviews elements of crime. No comments on facts. Ct finds understands pleas know/vol given, understands rights given up, Ct accepts pleas and finds def Guilty. 16CF10 pTAC delivery met, 18CF43 obstructing officer,  18CF71 felony BJ repeater. Ct orders PSI, filed 2 weeks before hearing, author not required unless atty makes arrangments.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2018 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Travis S Slattery in court for Defendant Jose Antonio Smart. Prosecuting Atty Kelly McKnight appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Jose Antonio Smart appeared by video means. Atty Slattery has rec discovery, has not been able to have a discussion with the DA yet. Has filed motion to modify bail. Atty Slattery comments has $300 for cash bond cannot post the $750. DA opposes the request, comments on prior record, amount minimum to secure appr. Ct would consider $500 cash bail with cosigner for $2000 SB. Def comments could maybe come up with $400 and a cosigner, cosigner mother Arlene Smart. Ct orders $750 cash or $500 cash and a cosigner. Prior to the next hearing date the court will give a written opinion on motion to recuse DA. Ct will give the defense 2 weeks to respond, if does not hear anything will assume that the motion is still on the table.  Status conference scheduled for November 20, 2017 at 08:30 am.
